headline: Does NRG’s 1 GW Virtual Power Plant Push With Sunrun Change The Bull Case For NRG (NRG)?
summary: Earlier in December, Sunrun and NRG Energy announced a multi-year partnership in Texas to expand distributed solar-plus-storage and build a 1 GW virtual power plant by 2035, allowing aggregated home batteries to supply the grid during periods of peak demand. This collaboration reinforces NRG’s push into distributed, flexible power solutions, positioning the company at the intersection of grid reliability, residential energy, and utility-scale needs. Now we’ll examine how NRG’s push into a 1...

headline: Sunrun and NRG Energy Announce Partnership to Harness the Power of Distributed Energy in Texas
summary: SAN FRANCISCO & HOUSTON, December 16, 2025--NRG and Sunrun announce partnership to accelerate the adoption of home battery storage in Texas to help meet the state’s surging energy demand.

headline: Top-Ranked Utility ETFs Poised to Benefit From Recent Fed Rate Cut
summary: A third Fed rate cut this year is boosting utilities, making diversified Utility ETFs like XLU an attractive way to tap lower borrowing costs and steady dividends.

raw.headline: Top-Ranked Utility ETFs Poised to Benefit From Recent Fed Rate Cut
raw.summary: A third Fed rate cut this year is boosting utilities, making diversified Utility ETFs like XLU an attractive way to tap lower borrowing costs and steady dividends.

headline: Biggest US Power Auction Set to Deepen Affordability Concerns
summary: The results due late Wednesday will confirm what PJM Interconnection LLC — the nation’s largest grid operator, serving millions of Americans from Chicago to Washington, DC — will pay power generators to secure capacity starting in 2027.  The bill is expected to reach $17 billion, according to a Bloomberg survey of grid experts, policymakers and traders.  Surging utility bills are already shaping up to be an issue in the congressional midterm elections next year: Despite President Donald Trump saying electricity prices would be halved within a year of taking office, costs have increased.
